Docs.summary: The wrapper for the primitive type int.

remarks.para: The wrapper for the primitive type int.

Implementation note: The "bit twiddling" methods in this class use techniques described in and

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Lang.Integer Decode (string string);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Integer Decode(string string) cil managed

Docs.param: a string representation of an integer value.
Docs.summary: Parses the specified string and returns a Integer instance if the string can be decoded into an integer value.

remarks.para: Parses the specified string and returns a Integer instance if the string can be decoded into an integer value. The string may be an optional minus sign "-" followed by a hexadecimal ("0x..." or "#..."), octal ("0..."), or decimal ("...") representation of an integer.

Docs.exception: if string cannot be parsed as an integer value.

.method public static hidebysig int32 HighestOneBit(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines the highest (leftmost) bit of the specified integer that is 1 and returns the bit mask value for that bit.

remarks.para: Determines the highest (leftmost) bit of the specified integer that is 1 and returns the bit mask value for that bit. This is also referred to as the Most Significant 1 Bit. Returns zero if the specified integer is zero.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToBinaryString (int i);
.method public static hidebysig string ToBinaryString(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified integer into its binary string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified integer into its binary string representation. The returned string is a concatenation of '0' and '1' characters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToHexString (int i);
.method public static hidebysig string ToHexString(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified integer into its hexadecimal string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified integer into its hexadecimal string representation. The returned string is a concatenation of characters from '0' to '9' and 'a' to 'f'.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToOctalString (int i);
.method public static hidebysig string ToOctalString(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified integer into its octal string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified integer into its octal string representation. The returned string is a concatenation of characters from '0' to '7'.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToString (int value);
.method public static hidebysig string ToString(int32 value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified integer into its decimal string representation.

remarks.para: Converts the specified integer into its decimal string representation. The returned string is a concatenation of a minus sign if the number is negative and characters from '0' to '9'.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string ToString (int i, int radix);
.method public static hidebysig string ToString(int32 i, int32 radix) cil managed

Docs.param: the base to use for the conversion.
Docs.summary: Converts the specified signed integer into a string representation based on the specified radix.

remarks.para: Converts the specified signed integer into a string representation based on the specified radix. The returned string is a concatenation of a minus sign if the number is negative and characters from '0' to '9' and 'a' to 'z', depending on the radix. If radix is not in the interval defined by Character.MIN_RADIX and Character.MAX_RADIX then 10 is used as the base for the conversion.
This method treats its argument as signed. If you want to convert an unsigned value to one of the common non-decimal bases, you may find , #toHexString, or more convenient.

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.Integer ValueOf(int32 i) cil managed

Docs.param: the integer value to store in the instance.
Docs.summary: Returns a Integer instance for the specified integer value.

remarks.para: Returns a Integer instance for the specified integer value.
If it is not necessary to get a new Integer instance, it is recommended to use this method instead of the constructor, since it maintains a cache of instances which may result in better performance.
